metadata.title: CVE-2019-11707 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - high.
metadata.description: A type confusion vulnerability can occur when manipulating JavaScript objects due to issues in Array.pop. This can allow for an exploitable crash. We are aware of targeted attacks in the wild abusing this flaw. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.7.1, Firefox < 67.0.3, and Thunderbird < 60.7.2.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine msalvatore> PoC does not cause a crash in mozjs38. The code has also significantly diverged.

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu1').
